hackathon-description-text: Create what you're into. 24 hours of hacking & design — or mixing, learning, building games, creating concepts, and more.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Head of the CS Department, The University of Texas at Dallas
Senior Vice President IT Risk, MetLife
Marketing Co-Coordinator, HackUTD, Association for Computing Machinery at UTD

hackathon-requirements: To be elligible for prizes, submissions must:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The HackUTD top prize, going to the best overall hack! 3 surprise prizes — find out at the Closing Ceremony!
The HackUTD 2nd place prize, going to the 2nd-place best overall hack! 3 surprise prizes — find out at the Closing Ceremony!
The HackUTD 3rd place prize, going to the 3rd-place best overall hack! 3 surprise prizes — find out at the Closing Ceremony!
A prize for the hack affording the best and most well-thought out user interface and experience to its users, courtesy of the UX Club at UTD.
A Set of otaku swag going to the most weeaboo hack at HackUTD, courtesy of Funimation & Zakariya Ahmed.
Domain.com swag bag for punniest domain name!
Best tool that helps developers wins Github Octacat trophies, courtesy of MLH!

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=800 W Campbell Rd, Richardson, TX 75080, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Your project will be judged on uniqueness, complexity, coolness, and impact. Uniqueness - Is there anything else like it? Complexity - How much effort was put forth? Coolness - Does it make us go "wow"? Impact - Would people use it?
Your project will be judged on the experience it provides its users. How much effort was put into its user interface & user experience?
Your project will be judged based on the following - How weeby is it? How technically difficult was it? Would a weeaboo use it? How many? Was it weeaboo-tested and certified?

hackathon-location-address: 800 W Campbell Rd, Richardson, TX 75080, USA
hackathon-description-header: 500 students & 24 hours of ideas, hacking, designing, music, & more. Welcome to the largest university hackathon in North Texas.
hackathon-location-description: The University of Texas at Dallas
